page.title: 10RELIGION
page.content: The Norman arch,dated c1080, came from the first St.Maurice's Church dated c1700 as well as the beautiful plaques carved in the Flemish style of St.Matthew,Mark,Luke and John writing their gospels. The altar in the Lady Chapel was consecrated in 1393 and came from the Bedern Chapel,Bedern being a small street near the Minster.The reredos is painted on oak and the first panel shows St.Aiden holding a torch spreading the Christian faith with St.Paulinus and St.James the Deacon. The central panel shows the three Kings bearing gifts and the third panel St.Chad of Lastingham in North Yorkshire who brought the faith to Lichfield and St. Wilfred who completed the present York Minster.
